Marco Antônio Amaral Féris

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/5302453262865588
  • Última atualização do currículo em 01/05/2018

Dr Amaral Féris has a PhD in Project Management, Master?s Degree in Computer Science, Lato Sensu Graduate Course in Business Management, Bachelor?s Degree in Computer Science and Six Sigma Black Belt and Green Belt certifications. He research focuses on planning quality, process improvement and software development projects. Dr Amaral Féris is a lecturer in operations at University of Wollongong, and he was a lecturer in programme and project management at Cranfield University. In the industry, Dr Amaral Féris worked as a program manager at AEL/Elbit Systems, project management specialist at Australian National University, R&D manager at Hewlett-Packard, IT project manager and new product introduction engineer at Dell Computers, project manager at Altus Sistemas de Automação, and developer at Altus Sistemas de Automação and Chronos (assembler, C and C++). (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2018 - Atual
Enhancing the Quality of Planning of Software Development Projects
Descrição: Enhancing the Quality of Planning of Software Development Projects This is an applied research aimed at improving project performance, by elevating the thoughts on planning and introducing best practices in the development process, such as: 1) Identification of project?s characteristics, for helping managers in defining an effective management approach (i.e. one size does not fit all). 2) Evaluation of the quality of planning, based on rationale that one cannot improve something without first measuring it. 3) Focus on the most important issues, for helping managers in avoiding the waste of effort and time in activities that do not add value. 4) Learning lessons, for generating insights on how to improve the performance of subsequent projects. 5) Use of historical data, for reducing the psychological biases that prevent managers from making correct decisions (e.g. endowment effect, optimism bias and ambiguity effect)..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marco Antônio Amaral Féris - Coordenador / OFER ZWIKAEL - Integrante / Keith Goffin - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 2
2016 - 2018
Enhancing the Quality of Planning of Software Development Projects
Descrição: This is an applied research aimed at improving project performance, by elevating the thoughts on planning and introducing best practices in the development process, such as: 1) Identification of project?s characteristics, for helping managers in defining an effective management approach (i.e. one size does not fit all). 2) Evaluation of the quality of planning, based on rationale that one cannot improve something without first measuring it. 3) Focus on the most important issues, for helping managers in avoiding the waste of effort and time in activities that do not add value. 4) Learning lessons, for generating insights on how to improve the performance of subsequent projects. 5) Use of historical data, for reducing the psychological biases that prevent managers from making correct decisions (e.g. endowment effect, optimism bias and ambiguity effect)..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marco Antônio Amaral Féris - Coordenador / OFER ZWIKAEL - Integrante / GREGOR, SHIRLEY - Integrante.

Número de produções C, T & A: 2
2009 - 2015
Enhancing the Quality of Planning of Software Development Projects
Descrição: Esta pesquisa, baseada em Design Science Research (DSR), visa aumentar a taxa de sucesso de projetos de software através da avaliação da qualidade do planejamento e da introdução de melhores práticas no processo de desenvolvimento independente da metodologia utilizada pela organização..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marco Antônio Amaral Féris - Coordenador.

Número de produções C, T & A: 11

Outras informações relevantes

 
Summary of Skills and Achievements
? Extensive experience in managing programs and projects in organisations across different cultures (American, Australian, Brazilian, England and Israeli) and industries (defence, education, R&D, IT, manufacturing and industrial automation).
? Business oriented, with a focus on success, planning, process improvement and people.
? Proven experience in Six Sigma, CMMI, ISO9001 and several project management methodologies, including Agile, Microsoft Solution Framework (MSF) and Stage-Gate.
? Dell Community Service Ambassador in 2004, due to volunteer work with the YMCA.

Education and Qualifications
2018?UOW Continuing Professional Development Portfolio Level 1 Accreditation.
2017?Associate Fellow of the Higher Education Academy in the UK (AFHEA).
2016?Academic qualifications assessed by British National Academic Recognition Information Centre (UK NARIC V3000256518).
2015?PhD in Project Management, Research School of Management, College of Business & Economics, Australian National University (ANU), Australia.
2009?Skills assessed by the Australian Computer Society (ACS) (ASCO 2231-79?Computing Professionals).
2008?Six Sigma Black Belt certification, Flemming Consultoria e Treinamento/PGPQ (partner of American Society for Quality).
2005?Six Sigma Green Belt certification, Dell Computers.
2003?Master?s Degree in Computer Science, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (UFRGS), Brazil.
1999?Lato Sensu Graduate Course in Business Management, Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV), Brazil.
1990?Bachelor?s Degree in Computer Science, Pontifícia Universidade Católica (PUC-RS), Brazil.
